Ecclesiasticus *__05.1: Set not thy heart upon unjust possessions, and say not: I have enough to live on: for it shall be of no service in the time of vengeance and darkness.
Ecclesiasticus *__05.2: Follow not in thy strength the desires of thy heart:
Ecclesiasticus *__05.3: And say not: How mighty am I? and who shall bring me under for my deeds? for God will surely take revenge.
Ecclesiasticus *__05.4: Say not: I have sinned, and what harm hath befallen me? for the most High is a patient rewarder.
Ecclesiasticus *__05.5: Be not without fear about sin forgiven, and add not sin upon sin:
Ecclesiasticus *__05.6: And say not: The mercy of the Lord is great, he will have mercy on the multitude of my sins.
Ecclesiasticus *__05.7: For mercy and wrath quickly come from him, and his wrath looketh upon sinners.
Ecclesiasticus *__05.8: Delay not to be converted to the Lord, and defer it not from day to day.
Ecclesiasticus *__05.9: For his wrath shall come on a sudden, and in the time of vengeance he will destroy thee.
Ecclesiasticus *__05.10: Be not anxious for goods unjustly gotten: for they shall not profit thee in the day of calamity and revenge.
Ecclesiasticus *__05.11: Winnow not with every wind, and go not into every way: for so is every sinner proved by a double tongue.
Ecclesiasticus *__05.12: Be steadfast in the way of the Lord, and in the truth of thy judgment, and in knowledge, and let the word of peace and justice keep with thee.
Ecclesiasticus *__05.13: Be meek to hear the word, that thou mayst understand: and return a true answer with wisdom.
Ecclesiasticus *__05.14: If thou have understanding, answer thy neighbour: but if not, let thy hand be upon thy mouth, lest thou be surprised in an unskillful word, and be confounded.
Ecclesiasticus *__05.15: Honour and glory is in the word of the wise, but the tongue of the fool is his ruin.
Ecclesiasticus *__05.16: Be not called a whisperer, and be not taken in thy tongue, and confounded.
Ecclesiasticus *__05.17: For confusion and repentance is upon a thief, and an evil mark of disgrace upon the double tongued, but to the whisperer hatred, and enmity, and reproach.
Ecclesiasticus *__05.18: Justify alike the small and the great.
